'''Ilberic Brandybuck''' was a [[Hobbits|Hobbit]] of [[the Shire]].

==History==
Ilberic was the second son of [[Seredic Brandybuck]] and [[Hilda Bracegirdle]], born in {{SR|1391}}. In {{SR|1401}} little Ilberic attended [[Bilbo's Farewell Party]] with his family.<ref>{{App|Brandybuck}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The meaning of the name ''Ilberic'' is unknown. [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] noted that the names of the Bucklanders had a vaguely [[Celtic]] style.<ref name="Translation">{{App|Translation}}, p. 1135</ref>

[[Jim Allan]] suggests that the name ''Ilberic'' seems to be Germanic. It is a variaton of the name ''Alberic'' and contains the elements ''alb'' ("[[Elves|Elf]]") and ''ric'' ("reign", "rule"). [[Wikipedia:Alberic|Alberic]] is a dwarf king in medieval German heroic literature who appears in [[Richard Wagner]]'s [[Der Ring des Nibelungen|Ring cycle]].<ref>{{HM|IE}}, "Giving of Names", p. 191</ref>

==Other versions of the legendarium==
In an earlier version of the family tree for the [[Brandybucks]], the name of Ilberic was '''''Alberic'''''.<ref>{{PM|Trees}}, Brandybuck of Buckland, BR 5</ref>
